issue.title: Look for test files recursively
issue.body:
https://github.com/hillstreetlabs/espresso/blob/81e74adadacce3815879b377e50979c44c4ce28e/src/espresso.js#L67

This would be a nice feature and is a quick fix, using a package like [file](https://github.com/mikeal/node-utils/tree/master/file). You may also want to consider allowing several test paths from the command line.

issue.title: No windows 10 support?
issue.body:
```
   >yarn global add espresso-tests
yarn global v1.3.2
[1/4] Resolving packages...
warning espresso-tests > ganache-core > merkle-patricia-tree > level-ws > xtend > object-keys@0.4.0:
[2/4] Fetching packages...
info fsevents@1.1.3: The platform "win32" is incompatible with this module.
info "fsevents@1.1.3" is an optional dependency and failed compatibility check. Excluding it from installation.
[3/4] Linking dependencies...
warning "espresso-tests > mocha-parallel-tests@1.2.10" has incorrect peer dependency "mocha@^3".
[4/4] Building fresh packages...
success Installed "espresso-tests@1.0.5" with binaries:
      - espresso
Done in 123.16s.
```

```
   >espresso --watch
espresso : The term 'espresso' is not recognized as the name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or operable program.
Check the spelling of the name, or if a path was included, verify that the path is correct and try again.
At line:1 char:1
+ espresso --watch
+ ~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : ObjectNotFound: (espresso:String) [], CommandNotFoundException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : CommandNotFoundException
```
